snippet: A Tibetan monk and his nephew are accused of helping others set fire to themselves in protest of Chinese rule, China’s state news agency reported.
abstract: Chinese police detain Tibetan monk Lorang Konchok and his nephew, accusing them of playing role in series of self-immolations; move appears to be part of campaign to prosecute Tibetans suspected of aiding others who set fire to themselves in protest of Chinese rule.
lead_paragraph: A Tibetan monk and his nephew are accused of helping others set fire to themselves in protest of Chinese rule, China’s state news agency reported.

headline.seo: Chinese Police Detain Two Tibetans in Self-Immolation Protests
headline.main: China Detains Two Tibetans in Self-Immolation Protests
headline.print_headline: China Detains Two Tibetans In Self-Immolation Protests
